__e: If my son is not too busy monitoring my cure, I'd like him to meet us.
Well, I command you to find the cure wherever it is in this world.
If we're successful, you could use them as leverage... force the High Council to give us more time to find a cure.
This is bigger than curing cancer.
Six months away from curing cancer and I give it up for this.
I can't see why anyone would want to stop a cure for disease.
You know, you probably should've spent a little more time finding a cure for what ails me.
Because he gave me the thing that you couldn't: the cure to my illness, embracing who I really am.
For all we know, there could be a cure for cancer just waiting to be found.
I'm trying to cure the disease.
Know that I add my prayers to yours for our daughter's soul to mend itself
There was little that could be done and the doctor gave him a month, at the most, to live.
